Navigate to other release versions of Doxee Platform Business Designer

[6.6](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/business-designer-6-6)

[6.7](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/business-designer-6-7)

While developing a template, the user can set a flag on certain elements and make them “refreshable”, meaning that at some point during Composer document composition, the Composer User can update these parts of document content without affecting the inserted building blocks or altered editable content. For this purpose, a Business Designer user can select an element which can be wrapped with a refreshable element, the same principle as wrapping with a condition or a repeat element. After wrapping the content, it is important to give a refreshable meaningful name which can be recognizable for the Composer User.

> Note

In the initial version, the naming convention of template parts apply also for the Refreshable element. Name cannot have white spaces, special characters or start with a number. This will be improved in future versions.

![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

*figure 1. Wrapping Content with Refreshable Element*

*![](data:image/png;base64,)*

*figure 2. Naming a Refreshable Element*

> Note

Since this functionality is available only in the Composer2nd Generation, templates with refreshable elements would appear in the Composer1st Generation as Insertion Points with an inserted building block, which contains the refreshable content.
